/-- A convex set `s` is strictly convex provided that for any two distinct points of
`s \ interior s`, the line passing through these points has nonempty intersection with
`interior s`. -/
protected theorem convex.strict_convex' {s : set E} (hs : convex ğ•œ s)
    (h : (s \ interior s).pairwise fun x y => âˆƒ c : ğ•œ, line_map x y c âˆˆ interior s) : strict_convex ğ•œ s :=
  by
  refine' strict_convex_iff_open_segment_subset.2 _
  intro x hx y hy hne
  by_cases hx' : x âˆˆ interior s; Â· exact hs.open_segment_interior_self_subset_interior hx' hy
  by_cases hy' : y âˆˆ interior s; Â· exact hs.open_segment_self_interior_subset_interior hx hy'
  rcases h âŸ¨hx, hx'âŸ© âŸ¨hy, hy'âŸ© hne with âŸ¨c, hcâŸ©
  refine' (open_segment_subset_union x y âŸ¨c, rflâŸ©).trans (insert_subset.2 âŸ¨hc, union_subset _ _âŸ©)
  exacts[hs.open_segment_self_interior_subset_interior hx hc, hs.open_segment_interior_self_subset_interior hc hy]
#align convex.strict_convex' convex.strict_convex'

/-- A convex set `s` is strictly convex provided that for any two distinct points `x`, `y` of
`s \ interior s`, the segment with endpoints `x`, `y` has nonempty intersection with
`interior s`. -/
protected theorem convex.strict_convex {s : set E} (hs : convex ğ•œ s)
    (h : (s \ interior s).pairwise fun x y => (segment x ğ•œ y \ frontier s).nonempty) : strict_convex ğ•œ s :=
  by
  refine' hs.strict_convex' <| h.imp_on fun x hx y hy hne => _
  simp only [segment_eq_image_line_map, â† self_diff_frontier]
  rintro âŸ¨_, âŸ¨âŸ¨c, hc, rflâŸ©, hcsâŸ©âŸ©
  refine' âŸ¨c, hs.segment_subset hx.1 hy.1 _, hcsâŸ©
  exact (segment_eq_image_line_map ğ•œ x y).symm â–¸ mem_image_of_mem _ hc
#align convex.strict_convex convex.strict_convex

/-- Every vector in `std_simplex ğ•œ Î¹` has `max`-norm at most `1`. -/
theorem std_simplex_subset_closed_ball : std_simplex (exprâ„) Î¹ âŠ† metric.closed_ball 0 1 :=

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprâ„ -/
/-- A nonempty convex set is path connected. -/
protected theorem convex.is_path_connected {s : set E} (hconv : convex (exprâ„) s) (hne : s.nonempty) :
    is_path_connected s := by

/-- Given a point `x` in the convex hull of `s` and a point `y` in the convex hull of `t`,
there exist points `x' âˆˆ s` and `y' âˆˆ t` at distance at least `dist x y`. -/
theorem convex_hull_exists_dist_ge2 {s t : set E} {x y : E} (hx : x âˆˆ convex_hull (exprâ„) s)
    (hy : y âˆˆ convex_hull (exprâ„) t) : âˆƒ x' âˆˆ s, âˆƒ y' âˆˆ t, dist x y â‰¤ dist x' y' :=
  by

  rcases convex_hull_exists_dist_ge hy x' with âŸ¨y', hy', Hy'âŸ©
  use x', hx', y', hy'
  exact le_trans Hx' (dist_comm y x' â–¸ dist_comm y' x' â–¸ Hy')

/-- Emetric diameter of the convex hull of a set `s` equals the emetric diameter of `s. -/
@[simp]
theorem convex_hull_ediam (s : set E) : emetric.diam (convex_hull (exprâ„) s) = emetric.diam s :=
  by

  rw [â† edist_dist]
  exact emetric.edist_le_diam_of_mem hx' hy'
